intro: Chaetogastra hypericoides, commonly known as the goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and smartweeds. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats.
